page.title: 18Slang in Billingshurst
page.content: Old Sussex dialect words like{twitten} (for a narrow lane) have tended to pass out of usage.{'Pumps'}for plimsolls is a word that has been around for some time and{'Square'}a word from the late 1950's & 60's, meaning unfashionable, has been revived. Some slang words are in usage because of their use by television characters (eg{'Naff'}= useless or{ {'Bottle'}= courage). Other current slang words have come into usage from mysterious origins (eg{'Wally'}= someone who is useless or{'swivel'}= go away and stop being tiresome). Some are inherited from America such as { {'Turkey'}(someone who is stupid) and{ {'Nerd'}(someone who is stupid!).Others like{'strides'}for trousers, seem to have a London origin. Lack of immigrants into the area has meant fewer influences for change.
